The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in programming, setting up, and proving jobs in 4/5-axis vertical machining centers (VMCs). You will play a critical role in producing high-precision components, ensuring quality, and optimizing machining processes. Responsibilities: Develop, implement, and optimize CNC programs for 4/5-axis VMCs. Read and interpret technical drawings, blueprints, and CAD models. Select appropriate tools, fixtures, and materials for machining operations. Programme, set up and prove jobs for production and prototype parts. Perform routine machine maintenance and troubleshooting. Ensure all parts meet specified tolerances and quality standards. Collaborate with the engineering and production teams to improve processes. Maintain a clean and safe work environment. Qualifications: Proven experience as a CNC Programmer, specifically with 4/5-axis VMCs. Proficient in CAD/CAM software preferably in MASTERCAM / HYPERMILL. Strong understanding of G-code and M-code programming. Ability to read and interpret complex technical drawings and blueprints. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. column2: Dura Placements  is looking for Tool Room Engineer  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.Tool and Equipment Maintenance: Inspecting, repairing, and maintaining tools, machinery, and equipment in the tool room to ensure they are in proper working condition. This includes conducting regular maintenance, servicing, and calibration. Tool Design and Development: Collaborating with the engineering and design teams to develop and design new tools and fixtures to improve production processes and efficiency. Tool Inventory Management: Managing the inventory of tools, spare parts, and consumables in the tool room. This involves keeping track of stock levels, reordering when necessary, and maintaining accurate records. Tool Repairs and Troubleshooting: Addressing tool-related issues and breakdowns promptly, troubleshooting problems, and executing repairs to minimize downtime. Tool Procurement: Identifying the need for new tools and equipment, researching suppliers, obtaining quotes, and making purchase recommendations to management. Cost Control: Monitoring tool room expenses and implementing cost-saving measures wherever possible without compromising on quality and safety. Safety Compliance: Ensuring that all tools, machinery, and equipment meet safety standards and regulations. Implementing safety protocols and providing training to staff on safe tool handling and usage. Training and Supervision: Training and supervising tool room staff to ensure they are skilled in their roles, following safety procedures, and adhering to company policies. Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for process improvement within the tool room, such as implementing new technologies or practices to enhance productivity and efficiency. Documentation: Maintaining detailed records of tool room activities, including maintenance schedules, repair logs, inventory lists, and safety compliance reports. Collaborative Projects: Collaborating with other departments, such as production, engineering, and quality assurance, to support their tooling needs and address any issues that may arise. Tool Room Organization: Organizing the tool room to maximize efficiency and accessibility of tools, equipment, and spare parts. Quality Control: Ensuring that all tools and equipment meet the required quality standards and conducting inspections as needed.
column11: Room

column2: Role & responsibilities    Dear Professionals.,   Greetings from Masadir!   We have urgent job opening for  Senior Engineer (Tooling & Process Development)  job in well-established MNC Automotive company in  Chennai ,  Tamil Nadu  location.   JOB DETAILS:   Position:   Senior Engineer (Tooling & Process Development)   Location:   Chennai ,  Tamil Nadu   Salary : Industry Standards   Qualification:  BE/B. Tech  Mechanical or Tool & Die Making Experience:  7 -10 years of experience in Manufacturing. Job Description: Responsible for resolving any tools or fixtures related problem in Canning production. Ensuring on time availability of tools for continuous production and achieving the OEE. Developing a comprehensive maintenance program for all the tools and fixtures in a periodic manner to avoid any downtime or repairing of tools and fixtures. Leading the RCA process and implementing appropriate corrective actions to avoid any recurring problem caused due to fixture or tools. Keeping records of maintenance and repair activities done in the line as a Lesson learnt and horizontally deploying the same actions wherever applicable. Developing standards for Fixture design & Development based on the past failures and improvement actions. Ordering & maintaining Suitable spares/ consumables in advance for critical items to avoid any stock out and line stoppage. Contributing to the DAP process for any new tools & fixtures development to prove out and maintaining detailed drawings / records for all tools & fixtures. Responsible to design and proving of proto production fixtures. Compliance to IATF, IMS standards Conduct detailed analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and developing suitable actions. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth integration of New Products or Process, equipment. Responsible to develop a storage plan for the existing as well as new tools/ fixtures. Accountabilities: Accountable for maintaining Tools & Fixture Achieving downtime due to tools/ fixtures to meet target OEE/ TPH Achieving target ppm and COPQ Implementation and maintaining TPM program for all fixtures/ tools. Spares and consumables management Accountable for implementing Continuous Improvement, VAVE projects. Proto fixture development and supporting production to deliver good parts. Required Skills: Tool & Fixture management  Hands on experience in Tool & Process proving for new program. Knowledge of Sheet metal fabrication process. Continual Improvement projects like VAVE, SMED, Kaizens. Minimum  qualification requirements to manage this job: B.E Mechanical or Tool & Die Making. 7 to 11 years of experience in Manufacturing.  Substantial experience in working effectively in complex Matrix organizations.  Exposure in Sheet metal fabrication, Tool design & development & Tool TPM. Hands on experience in new product development, Fixture correction, Spare maintenance , Tool TPM activities. Ability to derive Critical spare list for Tools & proactive approach to prevent tooling breakdown. If interested, kindly share your updated CV to Srinivas.r@masadirhr.com  Please fill the below details: -  Total experience:  Current salary:  Expected Salary:  Notice period: Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits
